intro: Acinopetala herradurae, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a striking member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its vibrant red and orange tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and containers. Its unique appearance and ornamental value make it a sought-after plant among horticulturists and botanists.
